task.title: Use Grip Scale Function on Dynamic Blocks
task.shortdesc: You can scale the selected entity relative to the grip. Drag the entity outwards the base grip to enlarge its size, and drag inwards to decrease the size.

context.p: Once you have selected a dynamic block contains scale action, click the light blue grip on the dynamic block to display command line prompt as follows:
Scale dynamic block by using grip

step.cmd: Select the dynamic block contains move action.
Clickon the light blue grip of the dynamic blockto highlight the selected grip.
Command line prompt appears, do either of the following:
Specify "B(Base point)" option to relocate the base point for scaling.
Specify "U(Undo)" option to abort the last scaling.
Specify "X(eXit)" option to exit scale manipulation.
Specify the target location for grip directly.

step.info: After specifying the target location, the dynamic block will be scaled towards the orientation anddisplacement along the connecting line of the selected grip (or the new base point) andthe target point.
